comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to STANFORD CREW HISTORY 1893-1956, by G. Wayne Dow [ www.gdow.net/pdffiles/crewhist.pdf ], Seward was Varsity captain of Stanford Crew in 1912. Also, page 453 of Cornell Alumni News [ ecommons.library.cornell.edu/bitstream/1813/3529/3/014_38... ] indicates that Cornell lent Stanford and Capt. Seward its coaching launch in 1912. A Cornell launch is certainly in the other picture, www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2890283224/in/p... .

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See also www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163148987/ . That picture looks like the first three or four (from the left) in this one. According to NYT at query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F04E6DE113AE633A..., the crew is Olmsted (bow), Beale, Smith, Watkins, Duryea, Walford, Seward , Partridge (stroke), and Guerena (cox)

comment.author: 42026265@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Hudson Valley, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
